abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Technical Assistance Project
            has been conceived to help the Government implement, monitor
            and sustain its structural adjustment effort as supported by
            the Bank under a series of structural adjustment loans.  The
            project finances consultants, training and equipment to
            support three major objectives.  They include institutional
            development and improved fiscal performance of key
            public-sector entities; promotion of exports; and human
            resources development.  In particular, the project will,
            inter alia, help improve the financial and managerial
            performance of the revenue services and of the
            publicly-owned airline company and strengthen the Planning
            and Statistics Institutes, National Investment Bank of
            Jamaica, and the Ministry of Education.  It will also
            finance a manpower planning study to help identify ways of
            mobilizing, training and employing human resources.  In
            addition, the project will fund a facility to provide
            financing for technical assistance to exporters on favorable
            terms, as well as a study to reorient the incentives system
            to promote expansion of exports.  The project will also help
            the Government improve its planning and administration of
            externally-financed technical assistance.  A portion of the
            loan proceeds will be utilized for other priority needs as
            they arise.
